str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
First, before, principal, most important. Contracted superlative of pro; foremost.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
(in the neutral plural) specially (by implication) the Passover week.
When, at which time. From hos and te; at which too, i.e. When.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The feast of Passover, the Passover lamb. Of Chaldee origin; the Passover.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A primary verb; properly, to rush, i.e. to sacrifice; by extension to immolate.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Genitive case of an interrogative pronoun pos otherwise obsolete; as adverb of place; at what locality.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To make ready, prepare. From hetoimos; to prepare.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Singular

str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The feast of Passover, the Passover lamb. Of Chaldee origin; the Passover.
